detaileddescription.para: Function definition: processLine. Reads a line of CDL text and processes it into the data structure representing the circuit described by the text. Each word in the line of text represents a gate or a wire, and there are a maximum of 4 words in the line, with the second word being the gate, and the other words being wires. We can infer from the position of the word, aswell as the word itself, some of the properties of the gate/wire that the word represents.

parameterdescription.para: an integer specifying which line of CDL text is being passed, this paramater is only used to form an identifier for the gate (word 2) given by that line.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, bool reset, bool synchronous)
memberdef.name: simulateCircuit

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, bool reset, bool synchronous)
memberdef.name: initializeCircuitInputs

detaileddescription.para:
r Function definition: decimalToBinaryArray. Convert a decinal number to binary number, stored with each digit in consecutive elements of an array. Uses a bitwise AND on repeated right bitshifts of the decimal number to isolate the particular bit in the decimal number we
decimal
the decimal number
bin
the array
numBits
the length of the array
Function definition: printTimeseries. Prints a timeseries for the circuit, showing the state in each wire over time, until the maximum circuit time is reached.
Function definition: printCircuitInputs Prints the name of each input wire in the circuit

Function definition: countInputs. Counts the number of input wires in the circuit
the number, as an unsigned integer

Function definition: makeNode. Dynamically allocates memory for a new node in the circuit, and fills that memory with a CircuitNode struct, with the id (name) and the function of the struct set to the values given in arguments to the function. All other values are set to 0/NULL.
id
the id member (name) of the new circuitnoe struct
func
the func member of the new circuitnoe struct
CircuitNode for a description of the struct, and a list of possible functions.

Function defintion: splitString. Split a longer string into an array inidiviual words.
str
the string
dl
the delimitter to use
res
where to store the result.

Function defintionL trimString. Remove leading and trailing whitespace from a string.
s
the string.

Function defintion: is_empty. Test whether a string is 'empty' i.e consists only of whitespace.
s
the string

Function defintion: findNodebyId. Searches the circuit for a CircuitNode with a particular id and returns a pointer to that node.
id
the id to search for
a pointer to that node, or NULL if the pointer cannot be found.
Function defintion: initCircuit. Initialize all ciruit elements to null

Function definition: append. Insert a new node into the circuit at the next availble position
new_node
the new CircuitNode to append to the circuit.
CircuitNode
Function defintion: printCircuit. Prints a textual representation of the circuit.

Function defintion: printNode. Prints a textual representation of a node in the citrcuit.
node
the node to print.
CircuitNode

Function defintion: incrementCircuit. Calculate the state for each wire in the circuit.
synchronous
whether to calculate the state in each wire based on the value of the state at the previous time in each wire.

Function defintion: getGateOutput. Calculate the output of a particular gate.
gate
the gate to calculate the output for.
synchronous
whether to calculate the output synchrnously or asynchronously.
simulateCircuit.
the output of the gate.
Function defintion: setCircuitRunTime. Calculates the maximum runtime for the circuit, to determine up to which point to simulate the circuit when writing a timeseries or truthtable.

Function definition: isCircuitComplete. Test if the circuit is 'fully formed' i.e each node has an appropiate number of outputs/inputs connected, based on the function of that node.
whether the circuit is 'fully formed' or not.

The main method. The entry point to the program.
the exit status of the program.

briefdescription.para: this source file contains all function declerations necessary for building and running the program
